did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: This collection documents the activism and interests of Audrey Seidman of Albany, especially her work with Holding Our Own, a foundation dedicated to supporting feminist social justice.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives by Audrey Seidman in 2016.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Originally from New York City, but a longtime resident of Albany, Audrey Seidman worked at the Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services and the Jewish Association for Services for the Aged; the Center for Women in Government, part of the University at Albany, SUNY; and retired from the office of the New York State Comptroller. Seidman has been active in women's and community organizations for decades.
Seidman holds a MA from the Newhouse School of Communications at Syracuse University and a BA, magna cum laude, from the University at Albany, SUNY.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection includes materials from the organizations Holding Our Own and the Women's Building. Audrey Seidman served as a board member for Holding Our Own. The collection contains meeting minutes, press releases, correspondence, and special event files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.
